title: How do you get better?
body:
I want to get a lot better at this game. I try almost every game and I focus on improving and playing for improvement but I cant get out of Bronze 2 and it is where I also started. I have played about 200-300 hours since I got into Bronze 2 and still cannot get out. I main Katarina and I watch lots of videos and streams such as Gbay99, Nightblue, HotshotGG, SickMotion, C9, etc. How do I know if i'm improving and how can I improve on things to get to gold? 
I would really appreciate your advice.
FYI: http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=JacoFett   -- My profile

replies.body: You have also only played 50 ranked games which is roughly 25-30 hours of play time. not 200-300.

I meant since I started ranked I have played 200-300 hours (normal and ranked combined) worth of league and have no idea if I have actually gotten better even though I have been trying that whole time.

I play a lot of normals, but I don't think they help that much. People play out of position, play champions they normally wouldn't and all round just arent trying as hard in normals. You also get put against people with varying ranks.

Try playing more ranked consistently. I notice that most your ranked games are 1 or 2 a day then you don't play ranked again fro 5 or 6 days.
Ranked is the best way to improve your play and test whether you are getting better. If you climb you are getting better, if you don't, your not.

Some very basic advice:
If all the enemy team is dead push a lane, don't back and heal.
If the enemy jungler is top and you kill the enemy mid or bot lane, do dragon.
Raging at "feeders" doesn't help anyone
/mute is your friend
try timing summoner spells (5min for flash/tp, 3.5min for ignite/exh/barrier)
Learn how every champion works (basically). You should almost never go into a game and think: "damn i have no idea what the enemy champion does"
Thanks for writing all of this it's very appreciated.
Some basic and simple tips here, and very true.

FARMING is the most important skill a player can have

Then Map awareness
Then objective control
Then knowing when to fight
Then knowing when to exploit an enemy mistake
knowing HOW to exploit a mistake is the biggest thing.
Disagree, a game can be won with pure mechanical outplay, but a game can not be won without last hitting.
i meant in relation to the knowing WHEN to exploit. yeah i meant to only quote that 1 line but didnt quote anything it seems...gg

what i have been told (as im in the same situation as you)
working on csing the tips i was told is 
make a custom game and run a no rune page and no masterie page so its like your lvl 1 again
cs for 10 min and check ur score also if u can find the cs chart 
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/File:Perfect_Creep_Score.png

use that as a base and work from there ull be amazed how easy laning and "carrying" is with a decent cs score and alot of us bronzie noobs think kills wins game.....it helps but i have won games were we have had 10-20 less kills coz of objection control (turrets, dragons, side pushing lanes then backing and when the enemy goes to clear that wave push the other lane so they are always defending and moving backwards)
im only bronze 1 and am working on the game as well but this knowlage has helped me alot in the past 4 weeks were i was stuck in B5 ( B5 0 point to B1 in 4 weeks isnt good but im bronze and i need to "get gud"
hope this helps even a little

most important thing in this elo is objective control and knowing when to fight, see jungler top, take dragon, 3 or more in a lane, shove a separate lane, knowing your opponent is the easiest way to win lane and time EVERYTHING flash/buffs/ignite/dragon/baron even death timers

you should be warding, get a pink ward and ward the baron or drag bush, it will make you safer in lane, in late game fights hide the the fog of war (never start a fight with kat) even if they have no cc you will be blown up. wait until you can assassinate someone before going in.

Err........

Anyways, cs more, ward more. Either push lane then recall or go roaming when your lane opponent is mia.

Listen to what Sickmotion says. "if you are below plat, focus on farming better".
I see in some 30+ min games you don't even break 100cs, when you should be at 100 by 14-15 mins.

Watch Trick2G when he does Spectates of Bronze players, can help you out.
